gov.sandia.cognition.graph.inference

Class CostSpeedupEnergyFunction<LabelType,NodeNameType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cognition.graph.inference.CostSpeedupEnergyFunction<LabelType,NodeNameType>
  • Type Parameters:
    LabelType - The labels that can be assigned to nodes
    NodeNameType - The type used to name nodes
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    EnergyFunction<LabelType>, NodeNameAwareEnergyFunction<LabelType,NodeNameType>

    public class CostSpeedupEnergyFunction<LabelType,NodeNameType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements NodeNameAwareEnergyFunction<LabelType,NodeNameType>
    This class trades memory usage (to store all of the costs) for compute time. We've found that sometimes one of the slowest parts of belief propagation is the multiple log operations, and this class eliminates a significant number of those. It appears that it depends on the size of the graph if the memory overhead outweighs the benefits of the less computations.
    Author:
    jdwendt

    • Method Detail

      • clearStoredCosts

        public void clearStoredCosts()
        Clears the pre-computed costs that were stored to keep from calling log and potential each time. Necessary for if we want to re-use the function without re-initializing memory.

      • getEdge

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getEdge(int i)
        Description copied from interface: EnergyFunction
        Returns the indices for the two endpoints in the specified path. The path ID should be 0-indexed and all paths from 0 through ( EnergyFunction.numEdges() - 1) should return a non-null value. All path IDs outside that range should throw an Exception.
        Specified by:
        getEdge in interface EnergyFunction<LabelType>
        Parameters:
        i - The path ID (should be in [0 ... EnergyFunction.numEdges()) ).
        Returns:
        The two endpoints' IDs (to be used for #getUnaryCost(int) and #getPairwisePotential(int, int, Object, Object))
        See Also:
        EnergyFunction.getEdge(int)

      • getUnaryPotential

        public double getUnaryPotential(int i,
                                LabelType label)
        Description copied from interface: EnergyFunction
        Returns the unary cost for node i having the input label. i must be a valid node id returned from EnergyFunction.getEdge(int). If not, an exception should be thrown.
        Specified by:
        getUnaryPotential in interface EnergyFunction<LabelType>
        Parameters:
        i - The index of the node whose unary cost should be returned

      • getPairwisePotential

        public double getPairwisePotential(int edgeId,
                                   LabelType ilabel,
                                   LabelType jlabel)
        Description copied from interface: EnergyFunction
        Returns the pairwise cost of node i being assigned label_i and node j being assigned label_j. NOTE: i and j must be the two endpoints returned by EnergyFunction.getEdge(int) in the ordere specified by the returned pair (i = getFirst, j = getSecond). If not, an exception should be thrown.
        Specified by:
        getPairwisePotential in interface EnergyFunction<LabelType>
        Parameters:
        edgeId - The id for the edge being requested
        ilabel - The label being (possibly) assigned to node i
        jlabel - The label being (possibly) assigned to node j
        Returns:
        the pairwise cost of node i being assigned label_i and node j being assigned label_j
        See Also:
        EnergyFunction.getPairwisePotential(int, java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)
